TestDescription.name: Environment variable information disclosure
TestDescription.Description: Environment variables are a set of dynamic named values that can affect the way running processes will behave on a computer. For example, an environment variable with a standard name can designate the location that a particular computer system uses to store temporary files but this may vary from one computer system to another. [break]Acunetix WVS found an environmental variable listed on this page. This is common for debug/test pages that should not be available in production system.
TestDescription.Impact: The environmental variable may disclose sensitive information. This information can be used to launch further attacks.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Restrict access to this file or remove it from your system.
